title: Whole Steamed Chicken with Spicy Cajun Rub

ingredients.content: 1 - 2 sprigs fresh sage leaves, to taste
½ lemon, thin peelings of skin and juice (approx. 30 g)
1 - 2 pinches fine sea salt, to taste
1 - 2 pinches ground black pepper, to taste
½ tsp dark brown muscovado sugar

preparations.content: Place parsley, thyme, sage and lemon peel in mixing bowl then chop <b>10 sec/speed 10<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula then chop again <b>10 sec/speed 10<b>. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place butter and onions in mixing bowl then chop <b>5 sec/speed 5<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula then sauté <b>4 min/Varoma/speed 1<b>.

Add reserved chopped herbs and peel, salt, pepper, sunflower seeds, lemon juice and breadcrumbs then mix <b>10 sec/speed 3<b>. Transfer to a bowl and set aside to cool. Clean and dry mixing bowl then prepare rub.
Place all spice rub ingredients in mixing bowl and combine <b>5 sec/speed 7<b>. Transfer to an airtight jar and set aside until needed.
Place whole chicken into Varoma dish and fill chicken cavity with reserved cooled stuffing. Rub 1-2 Tbsp of reserved rub into chicken skin.
Place water in mixing bowl and place covered Varoma into position then steam <b>60 min/Varoma/speed 1<b>.

Check to see if your chicken is cooked through (see tip). If chicken is not cooked, cover Varoma and steam for a further <b>10 min/Varoma/speed 1<b>, or until chicken is cooked. Transfer chicken to a serving platter, then carve and serve immediately.

hintsAndTricks: The rub on its own makes a great gift idea for friends and family.
Ensure your stuffing is completely cool before using.
To check your chicken is cooked, slice the chicken behind it's leg near to the chest. If the juices run clear, it is cooked.

If you don't want to use a stuffing in your chicken or time is limited, fill the chicken cavity with 2 garlic cloves, sliced, 1 whole lemon, halved and 2 sprigs fresh rosemary in step 6 and proceed as per recipe.
